org.mindswap.owl
Interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager

All Known Implementing Classes:
OWLKnowledgeBaseManagerImpl
public interface OWLKnowledgeBaseManager

Knowledge base managers are used to control behavior of loading ontologies (via readers) into knowledge bases. More precisely, one can specify whether certain ontologies should be ignored - not loaded - if they are (transitively) imported. Second, KB manager provide methods to (partially) dispose cached ontologies. Previously loaded ontologies can be kept (in memory) beyond the lifecycle of a KB and among KBs so that they can be efficiently reused. Third, one can specify alternative locations for ontologies which forces load/read from the alternative location instead of the default.

Instances may be shared among multiple knowledge bases.

Method Detail

addIgnoredOntology

void addIgnoredOntology(java.net.URI uri)
Add the ontology identified by the given URI to the set of ontologies we ignore in import statements.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology to ignore when importing.

clear

void clear(java.net.URI uri)
Clear internal cache partially or completely, that is, dispose one (all) cached reference(s) that is (are) kept of previously loaded ontologies.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology to remove from the cache. Completely clears the cache if value is null.

clearAlternativeLocation

void clearAlternativeLocation(java.net.URI uri)
Clear the alternative location for the ontology identified by the given URI, i.e., force that it will be loaded from this URI (i.e. it has to be a URL, in fact, that the system is able to resolve) when it is loaded/read the next time.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology for which to clear the alternative location.

getIgnoredOntologies

java.util.Set<java.net.URI> getIgnoredOntologies()
The set of ontologies which will be ignored (i.e. not loaded) if they transitively occur as imports in a ontology to be loaded into a KB.

Returns:
The set of OWL ontologies we ignore when importing. Empty set if none was added.

removeIgnoredOntology

boolean removeIgnoredOntology(java.net.URI uri)
Remove the ontology identified by the given URI from the set of ontologies ignored in import statements.

Parameters:
uri - The URI of an OWL ontology to take into account when importing.
Returns:
true If the set of ignored ontologies changed as a result of this method invocation, false otherwise.

setAlternativeLocation

java.net.URI setAlternativeLocation(java.net.URI original,
                                    java.net.URI copy)
Set an entry for a location where the ontology identified by the given URI can also be loaded/read from. This method needs to be invoked before the ontology is read/loaded to the KB that uses this manager.

Parameters:
original - The default or main URL of the ontology document.
copy - URL representing an alternative location where a copy of the ontology document can be found.
Returns:
The previous alternative location, if any, or original otherwise.

setCaching

void setCaching(boolean useCache)
Attention: When Jena is used as the backing RDF framework turning of caching only affects load/read of top-level ontologies and not imported ontologies. Imagine this property is switched to false. Thus, the internal cache will be entirely cleared. If a ontology that imports another ontology A is read/loaded afterwards, then A will be cached and any subsequent attempt to read/load another ontology that also imports A will get the cached reference (not accessing the source). This can only be circumvented by invoking clear(URI) with the URI of A as the parameter.

Parameters:
useCache - If true references of already loaded ontologies will be kept in a internal (main memory) cache to efficiently reuse them. Note that switching from true to false involves clearing the entire cache, see clear(URI).

usesCache

boolean usesCache()
Returns:
true if a cache is used which keeps previously loaded ontologies for reuse on repeated load, false otherwise.
